summary:
## Methanol: A Simple, Yet Important Chemical

Methanol, also known as wood alcohol, is a colorless, flammable liquid. It smells like ethanol (drinking alcohol) but is much more poisonous.  It used to be made from wood, but now it's mostly produced from carbon monoxide and hydrogen.

Methanol is important in making other chemicals, like formaldehyde and acetic acid, which are used in many products we use every day.
title: Methanol
